item.title: A note on the finitely generated fixed subgroup property
item.description: arXiv:2405.12824v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study when a group of form $G\times\mathbb{Z}$ has the finitely generated fixed subgroup property of automorphisms ($FGFP_a$), and provide some partial answers and non-trivial examples.
item.dc:creator: Jialin Lei, Jiming Ma, Qiang Zhang

item.title: Is decidability of the Submonoid Membership Problem closed under finite extensions?
item.description: arXiv:2405.12921v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show that the rational subset membership problem in $G$ can be reduced to the submonoid membership problem in $G{\times}H$ where $H$ is virtually Abelian. We use this to show that there is no algorithm reducing submonoid membership to a finite index subgroup uniformly for all virtually nilpotent groups. We also provide evidence towards the existence of a group $G$ with a subgroup $H<G$ of index 2, such that the submonoid membership problem is decidable in $H$ but not in $G$.
item.dc:creator: Doron Shafrir

item.title: Algebraic Constructions for the Digraph Degree-Diameter Problem
item.description: arXiv:2405.12374v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The degree-diameter problem for graphs is to find the largest number of vertices a graph can have given its diameter and maximum degree. We show we can realize this problem in terms of quasigroups, 1-factors and permutation groups. Our investigation originated from the study of graphs as the Cayley graphs of groupoids with d generators, a left identity and right cancellation; that is, a right quasigroup. This enables us to provide compact algebraic definitions for some important graphs that are either given as explicit edge lists or as the Cayley coset graphs of groups larger than the graph. One such example is a single expression for the Hoffman-Singleton graph. From there, we notice that the groupoids can be represented uniquely by a set of disjoint permutations and we explore the consequences of that observation.
item.dc:creator: Nyumbu Chishwashwa, Vance Faber, Noah Streib

item.title: Virtual homology of limit groups and profinite rigidity of direct products
item.description: arXiv:2209.14925v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that the virtual second Betti number of a finitely generated, residually free group $G$ is finite if and only if $G$ is either free, free abelian or the fundamental group of a closed surface. We also prove a similar statement in higher dimensions. We then develop techniques involving rank gradients of pro-$p$ groups, which allow us to recognise direct product decompositions. Combining these ideas, we show that direct products of free and surface groups are profinitely rigid among finitely presented, residually free groups, partially resolving a conjecture of Bridson's. Other corollaries that we obtain include a confirmation of Mel'nikov's surface group conjecture in the residually free case, and a description of closed aspherical manifolds of dimension at least $5$ with a residually free fundamental group.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Fruchter, Ismael Morales

item.title: The automorphism group of finite $p$-groups associated to the Macdonald group
item.description: arXiv:2303.06385v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Given positive integers $p$ and $m$, where $p$ is assumed to be an odd prime, we determine the automorphism groups of $p$-groups $J$, $H$, and $K$ of orders $p^{7m}$, $p^{6m}$, and $p^{5m}$, and nilpotency classes 5, 4, and 3, respectively, all of which arise naturally from the Macdonald group $\langle x,y\,|\, x^{[x,y]}=x^{1+p^m\ell},\, y^{[y,x]}=y^{1+p^m\ell}\rangle$, where $\ell\in{\mathbf Z}$ is relatively prime to $p$.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Montoya Ocampo, Fernando Szechtman

item.title: On Jordan algebras that are factors of Matsuo algebras
item.description: arXiv:2305.10958v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We describe all finite connected 3-transposition groups whose Matsuo algebras have nontrivial factors that are Jordan algebras. As a corollary, we show that if F is a field of characteristic 0, then there exist infinitely many primitive axial algebras of Jordan type 1/2 over F that are not factors of Matsuo algebras. As an illustrative example, we prove this for an exceptional Jordan algebra over F.
item.dc:creator: Ilya Gorshkov, Andrey Mamontov, Alexey Staroletov

item.title: Radical subgroups of finite reductive groups
item.description: arXiv:2401.00156v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Radical subgroups play an important role in both finite group theory and representation theory. This is the first of a series of papers of ours in classifying radical $p$-subgroups of finite reductive groups and in verifying the inductive blockwise Alperin weight condition for them, contributing to the program of proving the Alperin weight conjecture by verifying its inductive condition for finite simple groups. In this paper we present a uniform method of classifying radical subgroups of finite reductive groups. As applications, we investigate the inductive blockwise Alperin weight condition for classical groups, as well as groups of type $\bf F_4$.
item.dc:creator: Zhicheng Feng, Jun Yu, Jiping Zhang
